intro: Sterculia guangxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi sterculia, is a deciduous tree native to southern China, particularly Guangxi Province. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous elliptical seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
